repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
### Problem

Treesitter highlighting is slow for large files with lots of injections.

### Solution

Only parse injections we are going to render during a redraw cycle.

---

- `LanguageTree:parse()` will no longer parse injections by default and now requires an explicit `range` argument to be passed.
- `TSHighlighter` now parses injections incrementally during `on_win` callbacks for the redrawn line range.
- Plugins which require certain injections to be parsed must run `parser:parse({ start_row, end_row })` before using the tree.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    If {range} is provided and isn't `false`, will query and parse injections for the specified range. If `true`, injections will be parsed for the whole region. (This can be slow.)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1167,10 +1167,17 @@ LanguageTree:named_node_for_range({range}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         |TSNode| | nil Found node
 
-LanguageTree:parse()                                    *LanguageTree:parse()*
+LanguageTree:parse({opts})                              *LanguageTree:parse()*
     Parses all defined regions using a treesitter parser for the language this
-    tree represents. This will run the injection query for this language to
-    determine if any child languages should be created.
+    tree represents.
+
+    If {range} is provided and isn't `false`, will query and parse injections.

comment_data.body:
This is slightly ambiguous: Does it parse the range, or just _injections_ in the range?

(And the second sentence probably fits better in the preceding paragraph.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1167,10 +1167,17 @@ LanguageTree:named_node_for_range({range}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         |TSNode| | nil Found node
 
-LanguageTree:parse()                                    *LanguageTree:parse()*
+LanguageTree:parse({opts})                              *LanguageTree:parse()*
     Parses all defined regions using a treesitter parser for the language this
-    tree represents. This will run the injection query for this language to
-    determine if any child languages should be created.
+    tree represents.
+
+    If {range} is provided and isn't `false`, will query and parse injections.
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {opts}  TSParseOpts|nil Optional arguments:
+                • range boolean|Range4: Only parse this range in the buffer.
+                  This only affects trees which have an explicit range defined
+                  (injections) and does not affect the root tree.

comment_data.body:
The languagetree has "regions". A region can be empty (undefined) which means parse the whole ~buffer~ source. `range` does not affect these undefined regions.

So if you create a language tree and run `set_included_regions`, you've now defined regions to be parsed and thus `range` will be applied.

Injections are always defined regions, so `range` always applies.

I'll try and tidy this up. It was rushed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1167,10 +1167,17 @@ LanguageTree:named_node_for_range({range}, {opts})
     Return: ~
         |TSNode| | nil Found node
 
-LanguageTree:parse()                                    *LanguageTree:parse()*
+LanguageTree:parse({opts})                              *LanguageTree:parse()*
     Parses all defined regions using a treesitter parser for the language this
-    tree represents. This will run the injection query for this language to
-    determine if any child languages should be created.
+    tree represents.
+
+    If {range} is provided and isn't `false`, will query and parse injections.
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {opts}  TSParseOpts|nil Optional arguments:
+                • range boolean|Range4: Only parse this range in the buffer.
+                  This only affects trees which have an explicit range defined
+                  (injections) and does not affect the root tree.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
---@param range boolean|Range|nil: Parse this range in the parser's source.
---    This only affects regions in the source which have an explicit
---    range defined which includes: regions set with `set_included_regions()`
---    and injections.
```

This is a bit hard to parse for me (pun intended). Can you explain what exactly this `{range}` parameter controls, from a practical point of view?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -348,19 +385,61 @@ function LanguageTree:parse()
     end
   end
 
+  return query_time
+end
+
+--- Run a parse on the language tree.
+---
+--- If {range} isn't `false|nil`, then injections will be
+--- queried and parsed recursively.
+---
+---@param range boolean|Range|nil: Parse this range in the parsers source.
+---    This only affects regions in the source which have an explicit
+---    range defined which includes: regions set with `set_included_regions()`,
+---    and, injections.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- Recursively parse all regions in the language tree using a |treesitter-parser|
--- for the corresponding language and run injection queries on the parsed trees
--- to determine whether child trees should be created and parsed.
---
--- Any region with empty range (`{}`, typically only the root tree) is always parsed; 
--- otherwise (typically injections) only if it intersects {range} (or if {range} is `true`).
---
---@param range boolean|Range|nil: Parse this range in the parser's |source()|.
---    Set to `true` to run a complete parse of the source (Note: Can be slow!)
---    Set to `false|nil` to only parse regions with empty ranges (typically
---    only the root tree without injections).
```

Omitting mentioning `set_included_regions()` as this is `@private` (for now).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -348,19 +385,58 @@ function LanguageTree:parse()
     end
   end
 
+  return query_time
+end
+
+--- Run a parse on the language tree.
+---
+---@param range boolean|Range|nil: Parse this range in the parsers source.
+---    This only affects regions in the source which have an explicit
+---    range defined which includes: regions set with `set_included_regions()`,
+---    and, injections.
+---    Set to `true` to run a complete parse of the source. (This can be slow.)
+---    Set to `false|nil` to only parse regions with undefined ranges (typically
+---    this is the root tree).

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• |LanguageTree:parse()| will no longer parse injections by default and
  now requires an explicit range argument to be passed. If injections are
  required, provide an explicit range via `parser:parse({ start_row, end_row })`.
```

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  • Treesitter highlighting now parses injections incrementally during
    screen redraws only for the line range being rendered. This significantly
    improves performance in large files with many injections.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,6 +75,9 @@ The following new APIs and features were added.
 • Performance:
   • 'diffopt' "linematch" scoring algorithm now favours larger and less groups
     https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/23611
+  • The treesitter highlighting now parses injections incrementally during
+    screen redraws for the line range being rendered. This should provide
+    significantly improved in large files with lots of injections.

```suggestion
--- Recursively parse all regions in the language tree using |treesitter-parsers|
--- for the corresponding languages and run injection queries on the parsed trees
```

my bad... 😞

     end

comment_regular_data.body:
We probably want to specify the range here, too:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3d948a4dc4b2cd3c8d3ac497caf3dfe25adfb90d/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua#L165
(since `srow`, `erow` are available here).
Note to self: this requires changes in `nvim-treesitter` (`main`; I'm considering keeping `master` locked at 0.9.x).

Only other `parser:parse` I could find outside our tests is 
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/3d948a4dc4b2cd3c8d3ac497caf3dfe25adfb90d/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_query_linter.lua#L274
which should be fine (since we don't have any injections for query language).

title: feat(treesitter)!: incremental injection parsing
